title: Income Distribution
question_text:
A journalist wants to know how much money the typical employee earns at a small business.
If the distribution is right-skewed, what measure would best describe what the typical employee earns at this business?
solution:
The median best describes what the typical observation is in a data set.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect; since the distribution is right-skewed, the mean will be pushed to the right, which runs the risk of exaggerating what the typical employee earns.

Choice 'C' is incorrect; the mode might only describe what two of the employees earn; if every employee earns a different amount, there wonâ€™t even be a mode.

Choices 'D' and 'E' are incorrect; these selections give measures of spread and do not accurately describe what the typical employee earns.
